data.enText: part of whole
data.chText: 部分

data.enText: a part or share of a whole
data.chText: 部分；份额

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: Water covers a large proportion of the earth's surface.
data.chText: 水覆盖了地球表面的大部分。

data.enText: Loam is a soil with roughly equal proportions of clay, sand and silt.
data.chText: 壤土是由大约等份的黏土、沙和粉砂合成的。

data.enText: The proportion of regular smokers increases with age.
data.chText: 习惯吸烟的人口比重随年龄的增长而上升。

data.enText: A higher proportion of Americans go on to higher education than is the case in Britain.
data.chText: 美国人上大学的比例大于英国。

data.enText: relationship
data.chText: 关系

data.enText: the relationship of one thing to another in size, amount, etc.
data.chText: 比例；倍数关系

data.enText: The proportion of men to women in the college has changed dramatically over the years.
data.chText: 近年来，这个学院的男女学生比例出现了剧变。

data.enText: The basic ingredients are limestone and clay in the proportion 2:1.
data.chText: 基本成分是石灰石和黏土，比例为2:1。

data.enText: The room is very long in proportion to (= relative to) its width.
data.chText: 这房间的长度比宽度大很多。

data.enText: the correct relationship in size, degree, importance, etc. between one thing and another or between the parts of a whole
data.chText: 正确的比例；均衡；匀称

data.enText: You haven't drawn the figures in the foreground in proportion .
data.chText: 你的前景人物画得不合比例。

data.enText: The head is out of proportion with the body.
data.chText: 头部和身体不成比例。

data.enText: an impressive building with fine proportions
data.chText: 比例谐调的雄伟建筑物

data.enText: Always try to keep a sense of proportion (= of the relative importance of different things) .
data.chText: 应常记在心，事有轻重缓急之分。

data.enText: size/shape
data.chText: 大小；形状

data.enText: the measurements of sth; its size and shape
data.chText: 面积；体积；规模；程度

data.enText: This method divides the task into more manageable proportions.
data.chText: 这个方法把要完成的任务划分成较为易于操作的步骤。

data.enText: a food shortage that could soon reach crisis proportions
data.chText: 可能会很快达到危机程度的粮食短缺

data.enText: a room of fairly generous proportions
data.chText: 相当宽敞的屋子

data.enText: mathematics
data.chText: 数学

data.enText: the equal relationship between two pairs of numbers, as in the statement ‘4 is to 8 as 6 is to 12’
data.chText: 等比关系；比例

data.enText: keep sth in proportion
to react to sth in a sensible way and not think it is worse or more serious than it really is
data.chText: 恰当地处事；看待事物恰如其分

data.enText: out of (all) proportion (to sth)
larger, more serious, etc. in relation to sth than is necessary or appropriate
data.chText: 不相称；不谐调

data.enText: They earn salaries out of all proportion to their ability.
data.chText: 他们挣的工资与其能力不相称。

data.enText: The media have blown the incident up out of all proportion.
data.chText: 媒体大肆渲染这件事。

data.enText: If proportion is used with an uncountable or a singular noun, the verb is generally singular.
data.chText: proportion与不可数名词或单数名词连用时，动词一般用单数：

data.enText: A proportion of the land is used for agriculture.
data.chText: 一部分土地作农用。

data.enText: If the proportion of is used with a plural countable noun, or a singular noun that represents a group of people, the verb is usually singular, but with a (large, small, etc.) proportion of a plural verb is often used, especially in BrE .
data.chText: the proportion of与复数可数名词或单数集合名词连用时，动词通常为单数；但如果是a（large、small等）proportion of，则常用复数动词，尤其在英国英语中：

data.enText: The proportion of small cars on America’s roads is increasing.
data.chText: 美国公路上小汽车的比例在逐渐增加。

data.enText: A high proportion of five-year-olds have teeth in poor condition.
data.chText: 五岁儿童牙齿不健康的比例高。

simple_means.memory_skill: pro- 向前,在前 + port 部分,分开 + -ion 行为,状态

ex.zh: 部分成年人/儿童/男人/女人；成年人/儿童/男人/女人的比例

data.enText: keep sth in proportion
to react to sth in a sensible way and not think it is worse or more serious than it really is
data.chText: 恰当地处事；看待事物恰如其分

data.enText: out of (all) proportion (to sth)
larger, more serious, etc. in relation to sth than is necessary or appropriate
data.chText: 不相称；不谐调

data.enText: They earn salaries out of all proportion to their ability.
data.chText: 他们挣的工资与其能力不相称。

data.enText: The media have blown the incident up out of all proportion.
data.chText: 媒体大肆渲染这件事。

tr: harmonious arrangement or relation of parts or elements within a whole (as in a design)
example: in all perfectly beautiful objects there is found the opposition of one part to another and a reciprocal balance"- John Ruski

tr: the relation between things (or parts of things) with respect to their comparative quantity, magnitude, or degree
example: an inordinate proportion of the book is given over to quotations
a dry martini has a large proportion of gin

tr: the quotient obtained when the magnitude of a part is divided by the magnitude of the whole
balance among the parts of something
adjust in size relative to other things

example: harmonize a building with those surrounding it

example.ex: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die...
example.tran: 那片区域里的很大一部分海豚终将死去。

example.ex: A proportion of the rent is met by the city council.
example.tran: 一部分租金由市政委员会支付。

value.def: A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it.

example.ex: The proportion of women in the profession had risen to 17.3%...
example.tran: 从事该职业的女性比例已升高到17.3%。

example.ex: The radio station has to include a substantial proportion of classical music.
example.tran: 该电台不得不播放大量的古典音乐。

value.def: The proportion of one kind of person or thing in a group is the number of people or things of that kind compared to the total number of people or things in the group.

example.ex: Women's bodies tend to have a higher proportion of fat to water.
example.tran: 女性的身体内脂肪与水分的比例往往更高。

value.def: The proportion of one amount to another is the relationship between the two amounts in terms of how much there is of each thing.

example.ex: In the tropics plants grow to huge proportions.
example.tran: 在热带，植物会长得非常高大。

value.def: If you refer to the proportions of something, you are referring to its size, usually when this is extremely large.
value.tran: （通常指极其巨大的事物的）大小，尺寸

example.ex: You can vary the relative proportions of things in a picture very simply.
example.tran: 你能很简单地改变一幅画中事物的相对比例。

value.def: If you refer to the proportions in a work of art or design, you are referring to the relative sizes of its different parts.
value.tran: （艺术品或设计的各部分之间的）比例

example.ex: The pressure in the cylinders would go up  in proportion to the boiler pressure.
example.tran: 汽缸内的压力会随着汽锅压力的增加而相应增加。

value.def: If one thing increases or decreases in proportion to another thing, it increases or decreases to the same degree as that thing.

example.ex: Children tend to have relatively larger heads than adults in proportion to the rest of their body.
example.tran: 与成人相比，儿童头部占整个身体的比例相对较大。

value.def: If something is small or large in proportion to something else, it is small or large when compared with that thing.

example.ex: The punishment was out of all proportion to the crime.

value.def: If you say that something is out of all proportion to something else, you think that it is far greater or more serious than it should be.
value.tran: 与…极不成比例；与…完全不相称

example.ex: Everything just got blown out of proportion...
example.tran: 所有一切都变得不可收拾了。

example.ex: We've got to keep this in proportion.
example.tran: 我们应当正确对待这一点。

value.def: If you get something out of proportion, you think it is more important or worrying than it really is. If you keep something in proportion, you have a realistic view of how important it is.

example.ex: We must not lose our sense of proportion.
example.tran: 我们不能丧失主次观念。

value.def: If someone has a sense of proportion, they know what is really important and what is not.
value.tran: 区别轻重缓急的能力；分寸感；主次观念

trans: 很大比例的；一大部分；至於
区别轻重缓急的能力；分寸感；主次观念
